Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel with Ok location and some inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Elmoher
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning was only in heating mode. No cooling this time of year, althought outside temperature was over 20 degrees. We had to keep the window open to cool the hot room. Even when the air conditioning is working, you can't control it by yourself and you will have to call for reception to adjust temperature. There is good wifi coverage in hotel but it is quite expensive, 1,5 EUR per hour. Breakfast is really basic and there is surcharge if you want cheese or ham with your toasts. Included breakfast contais only bread, croissant, jam, coffee and juice. Shower is in the middle of the toilet and the whole floor will be wet after taking shower. Location near the railway and subway stations is convenient. Regional trains from Fiumicino airport stop at the Ostiense station. Room was basic, clean and service was always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Well, you can't fault the location!”
Reviews.Author: Zoe C
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pyramid. A lot can be said about this palce, some of them good and others not so much!! I better start with the good. We arrived in Rome at 8am on a Monday morning thinking that there would be no way that our room would be ready, or that there would even be a room for us! We were so relieved to hear the woman at the check in desk say that they could put us in a room. We were able to go and freshen up (which was exactly what we wanted after 7 hours overnight in Milan airport!) The second great thing about this hotel is the location. You are about a 5 minute walk from three train stations, one of which goes to Fuminco Airport and the other two are metro stations on the blue line, or the B line. The metro is by far the easiest way to get around the city so that was great! The street which the hotel is located on is also great. There is heaps or restraunts and pizza places so you can find a meal to suit all budgets. For those who miss fast food there is also a Burger King on the corner which makes quick late night meals easy. Speaking of meals the breakfast provided is exactly what you would expect from a European two star hotel. Pastries and bread rolls with spreads and ham as well as fruit juice and a machine which makes hot drinks and hot water for teas. However there were a couple of downsides - first off there was no lift. This wasn't a major problem though. We were on the second floor and I had a massive suitcase, so I think that if I can manage this then most people can!! (I'm not known for my upper body strength!) Secondly and most majorly was the bathrooms. You couldn't really even call it a room, more of a small cupboard smaller than a single mattress. If you open the door too quickly, as we discovered when we first arrived, you will smash into the toilet. Petty much if you wanted to you can sit on the toilet and shower at the same time. That is how small the room is. Another problem we had with the bathroom, however this could have only been a problem in out room, was that the drain did ot drain very fast at all and after two minutes the water was up to your ankles. We needed to use a spare towel outside the door to stop the water flooding into our room. So there were good and bad parts to the Hotel Pyramid but the main question is would I stay there again? The short answer is yes I would. Maybe not with my parents on a nice family holiday, but if I was coming with friends who I didn't mind being in close quarters to for a week then I would return. S if you're looking for a no frills place to stay, which has an excellent location then you cannot go past the Hotel Pyramid Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Southwestpt
Reviews.Content: A small hotel but cheap and does the job. Room small but had air con, bathroom not the best as has not very good shower but clean enough. Breakfast was rubbish - were english and like a english breakfast so no luck here suppose its good if you like toast and cereal. There is a club next door which gathers a crowd ay night but cant hear it in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Weird hotel services, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: JuanKong
Reviews.Content: I've read many reviews of this hotel prior to booking. Usually Tripadvisor reviews can be quite harsh but this case prior poor reviews about this hotel were true. The reason we booked here was because it was cheap and Rome is not a cheap place. Location was not great. Metro station was a 10 minute walk away and not many restaurants in this area. I didn't feel safe walking around the area at night and the street it is on is filthy. We pretty much only slept in the room as we were out and about during the day. Room was quite large for the both of us. Had a balcony with a nice view of the apartments across from us.... Had a TV which was quite small, and did not have a remote. You have to pay a bond for the remote! Which I've never heard of. The bathroom was a wetroom, I could of taken a shower whilst doing my business on the toilet if I wanted. It was quite awkward having it that way. Room was extremely hot, everytime we wanted to turn the AC on we had to call reception. WIFI is chargeble here. I didn't believe my belongings were secure in this hotel. We left early one morning closed all the doors. We arrived back later that night finding our balcony door wide open. The balcony is shared with other rooms in the hotel. I would say the cleaner left the door open for fresh air but thankfully nothing was missing. After that we actually stayed in the room every morning until the cleaner finished cleaning our room before we could go sight seeing to make sure everything was secure. On our final night the porter asked us for our key when we left the building which I have never come across either. There's a heavy metal bar next door but was not that loud like previous reviews made it out to be. At least the Colosseo was a 20 minute walk away and the breakfast that was served was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give this 3.5 if it were possible”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid that the difference between "Average" and "Very Good" is in my view quite large and so I plumped for the former when I'd really have wanted to give it a "Pretty good". We stayed there for a week earlier this month, having previously stayed there as part of a package in 2005. This time we selected it ourselves and we weren't disappointed on our return. Given that Roman hotels are expensive I don;t think you could say Hotel Pyramid is exactly cheap (though they often have deals on their website which help soften the financial blow). But it has two very big pluses: cleanliness (on both our trips our rooms were spotless) and location. On the latter point it depends, of course, where you want to go and what you're looking to do. But for us Hotel Pyramid is ideal. You can walk easily in half an hour through Testaccio or up the Aventine to Circeo Massimo and the ancient centre. You're five minutes' walk from two overground stations (Ostiense and Porta San Paolo) and one underground station (Pyramid), as well as close by a major bus terminal: this means you can roll your suitcase easily from the Fumicino airport train to your hotel; you can go on day trips (Ostia Antica is exceptional); and you can get round the city quickly by Metro (Colosseo is just a few minutes from Pyramid, Termini mainline station similarly). All in all, if you're planning to use the public transport systems to see more of Rome and its environs, this place is great. The other advantage to this hotel's location is the presence of decent and affordable eating nearby. Everything from the Testaccio restaurants and some traditional Roman joints on the Aventine to sit-in diners on Via Ostiense is at your disposal. I guess the ultimate test is whether we'd go again ourselves. And, as you've guessed, the answer is definitely Yes.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep--that is it!”
Reviews.Author: sportsshrink
Reviews.Content: The Pyramid Hotel is just an average hotel. I do not spend much time in my room when travelling--I am usually out touring all day. I need a place to sleep and take a hot shower. This hotel served that purpose. It has some positive and negative features. The positive are: A comfortable bed, a hot shower and an adequate breafast. It was a basic breakfast--pastry, coffee, juice and rosette rolls. It was self serve and no limits on what you can take or consume. The negatives: The hotel is a good distance from the train station--if you follow the website walking directions, you are taken through a maze of tunnels with motorized walkways and escalators that don't work. I had a lot of luggage and this was a long tough journey. At the entrance to the Ostiense station--there is a strange tent village of street people--youth hanging around at all hours of the night--it might be a bit scary for those who aren't comfortable walking in a strange city at night. Another negative is that the hotel has no carpeting and you hear every footstep on your floor. I constantly heard chairs being push across the floor above me, doors slamming and footsteps. The rooms also have the silly system of having to conserve energy by putting your key card into a slot to power the room. I had read about this in advance. A little trick is this: I just jammed my club card from my local supermarket here in USA in the slot. I removed it in the morning and placed it back after housekeeping left. This way --my room fridge was kept running. The bathroom was a "wet room" There is no shower stall--just a drain in center of the bathroom and a curtain. My drain was slow so the whole floor filled with water. There is no possible way to get dressed in the bathroom--so if you are travelling with a friend--be prepared! I put my bath mat ooutside of the bathroom door--so i had a dry non slip surface to walk on when I was done showering. A few little positives--most of the staff were nice--the hotel is located near some restaurants--there is also a Carrefour supermarket close by--I would load up on wine, fruit, bottled water and cheese at the Carrefour and keep it in my fridge. They also sell sandwiches --so if you are touring you can load up and take a bite to eat with you. One quick suggestion I have is to recommend going to the town of Ostia Antica and view the archeological site there. There are basically three train stations at the Pyramid Station--The Roman metro--the suburban metro and the Ostiense train station. If you have a tourist pass or a simple one euro 75 minute ticket--you can travel 1/2 hour to Ostia Antica at the Suburban metro stop of Porto San Paolo. Once you get to Ostia--it is clearly marked and within walking distance to get to the Archeological site. It shows what a Roman town was truly like. It was the highlight of my trip. Overall the Piramid hotel was a place to sleep and shower!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silver_Greece
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel was 3 metro station away from the city centre and the stuff was very helpful. However, the room was small and the bathroom even smaller. I didn't like the lack of bathtube or at least shower. The ggod thing was that it had an en suite bathroom. Breakfast was poor and you have to pay extra if you want cheese and ham. Also, we had to give a deposit to take the remote control and when we wanted to use A/C we had to call the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2010 with my partner. Our first impression was not the best. When we got to the location the hotel (if you want to call it that) was down a narrow street. In the area itself i found it very dirty, there were used needles on the footpaths. The hotel itself, was clean, but the room was very small, and the bathroom was a wet room. As you opened the door you stepped up into the bathroom, right infront of you was the shower, the toilet was to the laft and the sink to the right. When you had a shower, the whole floor was wet which meant after you showered you and needed the toliet you would bring the water out to the main room. Thye have no faciities what so ever in the hotel.At night, there is a night club right next door, which meant music was blasting until about 4 in the morning and then to top it off there were works going on at the hotel which started at 7. The only good thing i can say about the hotel is that it was that bad i spent very little time there so i got to see a lot of Rome itself. I would definately go back and see Rome again, but i will look for somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “it was horrible”
Reviews.Author: clairethebear88
Reviews.Content: this is the first review i've ever written. it was so bad that i felt i had to warn people. first off, it's in a shady area. i know rome is dirty and anywhere can look sketchy, but this place is very sketchy. we were afraid to go out at night. secondly, their policy is that they are not responsible for anything being stolen from your room, and you still have to leave your hotel key at reception when you leave the hotel. they told us it was b/c the maids needed the key to get in the room. i don't know why they thought we were stupid enough to believe that they didn't have a master key, especially b/c we had maids come into our room more than once while we were sleeping and wake us up to clean (no do not disturb signs). other besides being woken up by the maid repeatedly (and we didn't sleep in late) we clearly had our key at the time. they would also skip our room for cleaning altogether b/c of this. we also did take the key with us one day. so, the receptionist was bold-faced lying. thirdly, they control the air conditioning. you have to call reception & ask for it to be turned on & then they put it on the lowest setting. on a hot summer night, expect at least 30 min before you cool down at all. we would have to take cold showers when we got home b/c we couldn't cool off in our room with the window open or with them being cheap with the air conditioning. and they would also turn off our AC for no reason and we would have to call yet again to have it turned back on & to say we never wanted it off in the first place. fourthly, be aware that like other hotels in europe, you have to insert the room card to get power in the room. so, our fridge was warm when we got there. we thought it would cool down with the power on, but it never did. when we told the front desk our fridge had a problem, they told us it didn't. so, we had to get into an argument with them over something as simple as the fact that the fridge wouldn't get cold. we lost a lot of food we bought from the grocery store b/c of this before they changed out the fridge. fifth, you have to put down a €20 deposit to use the tv remote. crazy, i know. they are REALLY after money any way that they can get it. sixth, you have to pay for the internet. you pay €1.50/hour. i paid once, but i didn't even get a full hour before i was cut off. by this time, i was so sick of dealing with all of their ineptitude and attempts at money-gouging, so we just started looking for internet cafes and really just tried to avoid being in our hotel as much as possible. seventh, the breakfast included is not a breakfast. it's hard old dinner rolls, croissants, butter, jam and coffee. that's it. don't expect meat, dairy or anything that will actually give you energy for the day. you have to go out and buy breakfast. it's definitely not worth waking up for. eighth, be aware that there is a €2/per person per night tax in rome as of july 2010 at 1,2 & 3 star hotels. so, after booking this hotel b/c it was the cheapest, it turned out not to be the cheapest b/c not all the taxes were included in the booking. we paid an extra €16 which made us REALLY know that we should have stayed anywhere else. ninth, the bathroom sucks. i'm used to wet rooms and small showers in europe. after traveling to many countries this past month, this bathroom was the worst. it was the worst b/c the shower is in the middle of the bathroom between the toilet and the sink. so, you wrap a curtain around you and that's it. there are no shelves or anything to hold your shampoo, soap, etc, so you have to reach outside the shower to get this stuff off the sink. and you have to be careful so you don't get your towel, clothes, the extra toilet paper, etc that's sitting on the sink wet. it's really a pain. tenth, it might matter to some that there is no elevator. it sucked for me b/c i had to lug 50 lbs of luggage up and down stairs. i had gotten used to doing it at other hotels, but it still sucks overall, this place really sucks. we didn't feel comfortable at any time. the dim rooms, the constant attempts to gouge for more money, the cheapness of the owners, the far commute to anything in rome, the lack of safety of belongings in our rooms, the people at reception blatantly lying, and much more just made everything about the place where we were supposed to be able to relax really unbearable. it really hindered our vacation to the point of making it very unenjoyable. save yourself the hassle and book somewhere else. it will probably be cheaper anyway once you include the tax mentioned above

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice place, good price”
Reviews.Author: ABieNRML
Reviews.Content: Was there with my girlfriend. It wasn't problem to find the way to the hotel, and we loved the old gentleman who welcomed us when we arrived at late night (time wasn't problem). We had nice, clean room with balcony, spent two comfortable and calm night there. All staff are friendly and helpful. Our biggest problem was the ascensor - what they don't have: so it was hard to get to the room with our luggages. And one more little: "continental" breakfast stood only pastries there, what was good but not my style. It's not an "out" (specially) LGBT-friendly place, but it definitely seemed to be - and it was good for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Bare Bones but Serviceable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kasejason
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pyramid for three days during a recent trip to Rome. We were drawn in by the cheap rates and close proximity of the hotel to the Ostiense and Pyramid train stations. The location was great for these purposes and allowed us to stay fairly close to the city center without paying a lot of money. The neighborhood had a lot of places to eat and was serviced by a few bus lines as well. The hotel staff were very nice and spoke English well. They were able to answer our questions about the city and explained all of their policies in a reasonable fashion. The room was clean and relatively comfortable (make sure you ask the front desk to turn on your air conditioning each night). Breakfast was included without charge and featured pastries, bread with jam, and coffee. Despite these positives, there were still a few problems with the hotel. The shower and toilet were together in the same area without a bathtub/ stall. This made showering awkward and somewhat difficult. The floor would flood with water and we would have to wait for it to recede before opening the door. Then, the bathroom floor would be wet all night and the following morning. Additionally, the room itself was somewhat cramped. As a final complaint, the hotel is located right next to a dance club/ bar, so the sounds of loud bass reverberated through the walls all night long. We were staying during a weekend, so it's possible that weeknights would be better, but the noise was unfortunate. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay that is near Rome and you don't mind a few inconveniences, then this hotel could be right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: Chandler_20
Reviews.Content: Would agree with the points rasied by Andres16, its a decent enough hotel and the staff are friendly enough but it is a decent 15 / 20 minutes walk to the main part of the city. Shower / toilet rooms are very small. Breakfast consisted of anything with loads of sugar and that included the fruit juice. Try the local resturant, great steaks, sorry I forget the name as its been a year or two since we went.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel - location / connections better than you'd think”
Reviews.Author: cheshiredave
Reviews.Content: Also more commonly called ABC Piramide / ABC Pyramid Hotel. I've stayed here twice, with a third time later this year. LOCATION / COST - 5 or 6 minute walk from the Ostia / Piramide twin train stations, which are more-or-less one and the same. The metro line connects with - well, all other metro stations, but the Ostia line connects to Ostia Antica (a day out) and even to the coast/beach ! We bought weekly bus/rail tickets that are now about 16 Euros, and include travel to the seaside. Fantastic value. In the hot weather, it's also easy to get to / from the station / hotel by the very frequent buses (every 3 or 5 minutes, daytime). There is also a train line from Fiumicino airport (NOT the express to Termini) but I haven't tried that yet as previously we landed at Ciampino and got the prebookable online and very cheap, very nearby Terravision Bus to Termini, then metro to Piramide. You can't use the 16 Euro tickets for those journeys, I believe. Or a shuttle transfer is about £13 British Pounds Sterling. You'll easily know when you're at the right station as there is a giant white marble pyramid and a brown castle just outside the stations. There is also quite a big bus station / interchange right next to the station. Even better. Just study the bus route numbers and times well - once you get the hnag of them, they are usually handier than the metro. The hotel was originally quite hard to find, but Google Maps and Street View now makes this easy. You can go to the top of the street on StreetView, but not down it as it's quite a narrow sidestreet that was probably not worth sending a camera van down. Don't be put off by the view of Burger King on the corner. A) It's sometimes handy after a very long day of walking. B) Kids might like it. Young kids, however, might be bored and feel confined in this hotel. Don't let the online view deter you. If you scroll a few yards left of the burger place, you'll see an upmarket ice cream / cake / coffee shop. We felt safe in this area, although it's hardly the Historical Centre. Not for £35 GBP per night (for the aircon room and continental breakfast, for 2 people), which is a fantastic price that I got by shopping around ferociously. In the event, it was cheapest to book a hotel and flight (a Swiss airline, from Manchester UK, change once at Zurich for Fiumicino) together through a well-known travel company, rather than my usual Liverpool to Ciampino flight with a budget Irish airline. There was a £30 rebate offer at the time, and I'll be getting an extra £20 back from a cashback site. (Well, I DO have Budget Traveller as my TripAdvisor profile. The side street is quiet but the nearby main street very busy (so use the zebra crossings!). However, the hotel is double-glazed with very cold but variable aircon, turned on by Reception on request and at no charge, so no need for open windows. Having said that, the rear rooms are very quiet, looking straight onto a big quadrangle with large pots of plants.This belongs to the flats opposite, forming the very large 1st floorquadrangle. These rear rooms have heavy grating to deter thieves from, say, accessing the quadrangle then getting into your room. Don't let this worry you. The 'grille' is probably also to stop hotel guests getting OUT and relaxing on the flat dwellers' private terrace. You'll see them across the way hanging out their washing on their balconies, painting their doors etc. The flat residents never seem to use the terrace, though, and tend to stay on their own little-used balconies. Rear rooms slightly quieter than front rooms, especially if you like open windows. Did not have any probs with basement club - very, very, very faint thudding when we were in the 1st floor back room. A few people congregated outside while we sometimes ate fresh pizza slices and drank Perroni at the small and crazily cheap pizza cafe more-or-less opposite the hotel. (Cafe mainly evenings only, I think.) The people were not a problem, friendly, no fights - it's the peaceful black T-shirt kind of people. HOTEL - pictures on the hotel's website are fair. Reasonably basic and smallish (some rooms with large wetroom but some with very small wetrooms that we did NOT find a problem at all). But not as small or basic as budget Parisian hotels. I think they grade themselves as 2 star, but 2.5 or 3 would not have surprised me. Tiled floots and marble strips to the lower halves of the walls. Ceilings high - you can just about reach the aircon machine over the door to change the air direction if you stand on a chair - and I am pretty tall. Simple breakfast served in the basement. Most guests seem to be backpacking or just there for 2 or 3 days. We always stay longer. Not that many tables, say 15, but never seems to get too crowded, and no queues for tables. We were always the last out! Coffee from a machine - Italian language, so think before you push and make sure you don't overflow your cup. Trial and error gets you there. Staff pleasant and helpful. Night porter. No problems with staff. Will advise on what to see, where to go etc. Also helped us phone and get a cab back to the airport on the last day. (Not cheap for a private Merc cab. Get a shuttle?) AREA / EATING / NIGHT-TIME - this is mainly a place to sleep and travel to / from. However, it's also now a late-night trendy clubbing area. DON'T let this put you off - the bars are a few hundred yards away and are never heard, but if you like clubbing, it would be a great area to stay in. (Warning - there are various offers to get you in through the doors, and they are trickier than they seem. Read all the small print - difficult if it's Italian. Some bars are fine, some charge quite a bit for your 1st drink with food - but whether you eat one crisp or a massive snack, it costs the same. Eat nothing and it costs the same.) There is also a nearby corner pizza restaurant (not tried) and 200 metres away a small good value restaurant. (This is Rome, so don't expect real bargain basement prices.) Go right ,out of the hotel's glass door for 100 metres; right again; and it's on the next corner. Insalata Ricca. It's on Google maps, as is the Abitart trendy hotel, where you can get just a drink, or have a meal, too. We had a drink but did not try the food. Dress reasonably smart for this one, as well as for the night clubs! For a few clubs, turn right; LEFT at the first junction, then there are trendy clubs / bars. Early evening, not busy at all, friendly, food pretty good and reasonable in cost. IN SUMMARY - very happy with this hotel, as long as you don't expect to be in it all the time and don't expect TOO much from it. TIPS - get a 3-day or weekly or monthly combined bus / metro ticket. This is NOT the same as the dearer one that has a few museum entrances included. Go to the beach for the day on the train from Ostia station, right next to Piramide metro station - they interconnect. The train looks like a metro train. Some beach access is free; much is payable but you get seats, bars, food. Seek and research well, including the best train stop to use and remember trains back to Rome may get crowded as it gets later in the day ! It's the same train for Ostia Antica, the ruined town (a bit like Pompeii - surf for Ostia Antica). The little town near the train station before you get to the ruins (so it's a small diversion) is very nice with a good bar / restaurant near castle walls. Walk uphill to The Knights of Malta 'keyhole' for a great view of St Peters. On the way are a rose garden and an orange tree garden (panorama view) to rest in. The Fontana del Gianicolo on top of the hill in Trastevere. Almost as good as the Trevi. Also, walk along this ridge / hill. Also, Trastevere itself - an Italian version of Paris's Montmarte. Cheap tourist food if you look hard. Hope all that helps. it took me 2 hours !

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: holban
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend and as we are students we were both on a budget so the price was good. We were not expecting much from the hotel to begin with but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was a decent size and the bathroom your average wet room with toilet and shower. Our room was cleaned and tidied every day as well as being given new clean towels. It was all we needed for a comfortable, clean place to sleep when we wanted to spend most of your time out exploring the wonders of Rome. The staff were very friendly and helpful which we used to our advantage when asking about places to go and how to get there. It is in a good location for sightseeing, with a short walk to the nearest metro station, Pyramide at only 10 minutes away. The only con was the included breakfast, if you could call it that. It was just a selection of strange cakes and small biscuit like pieces of bread in packets. Needless to say, we bought our own breakfast. However, overall the hotel was ideal for our needs as it was comfortable, clean and easy to get into and out of Rome whilst sticking to our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Weigh the arguments carefully before you book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: andres16
Reviews.Content: First, the "pro": 1. Good position, especially if you arrive from aeroport at night or/and intend to continue your trip from Rome in the direction of Viterbo. In some hundreds meters is situated train station Ostience, where stop both trains from Fiumichino and trains to Viterbo. 2. Good price for the hotel "not so away from centre". It is about 30 minutes on foot to Colosseo or two metro stations. 3. Polite staff. "cons": 1. Rooms are tiny. 2. Bathroom is terrible, very tiny. So named shower is bolted to the wall above the hole in the floor. 3. Very noisy nightclub next door. Clubbing people are not agressive but they are drunken, smoke all the time and are VERY noisy. 4. No luggage room. We had to put our bicycles in bags and take in the room, that is not large even without bicycles. 5. The breakfast is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit.... would go again”
Reviews.Author: chezabelle
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The main rason we chose this hotel was down to the location and staff. The rooms are basic the beds suffice and the price is good. If you want to see the cities attractions this is just far enough out to enjoy a stroll to all the main sites, jump on the metro, or even a cab. A cab is 8 - 10 euros, and was a treat on the last day for the tootsies! We would go again, for a cheap and cheeful break. Don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed. There is now internet access too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel - I was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sarahmac92
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2010 for a week. My ratings are based on the fact that it is a 2 star hotel and very cheap for Rome! I was on my own but the room I had was big, well furnished with good quality curtains and bed linen. The room even had a flat screen TV! - and was immaculately clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. I felt happy walking around the area at night even though I was a female on my own. And there is an excellent pasticceria if you turn left, then right out of the hotel on to Via Ostiense - called Andreotti. There is also a handy phone and internet centre on the same street, about 3 doors along on the left. If there were any negatives, they were the kind of things common in budget hotels...OK , the towels were thin but that's usual in budget hotels in Rome. The bathroom was a wet room but that didn't bother me. The breakfast was limited to pastries and coffee, but you don't go to Italy for the breakfasts! The location was out of the centre but very well served by transport - Metro and buses nearby, plus Ostiense station 10 minutes' walk from where you can take the train to Fuimicino Airport or to the beach at Ostia. All in all I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I would prefer to stay at some other place”
Reviews.Author: BarmanHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I have expected more for this price. I will write disadvantages, because as advantage I can only say that rooms were clean. 1. Noisy!!!. You hear everything happening in the neighbours rooms. You hear water drops from the shower, hairdryer, doors. 2. Breakfast is very poor. You get coffee and sweets. If you stay for more than 2 days you will start to hate sweets. 3. Small rooms. 4. Fridge did not work. 5. TV did not work.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better hotels than this”
Reviews.Author: Starspotter
Reviews.Content: First the good news: the water was hot and the shower worked! That is it! The staff very polite at best but some were downright unhelpful. it took two attempts to get a hair-drier which worked. I think the towels were a job lot of oversized Bounty kitchen roll. When my wife did not vacate the room until 11.15 the cleaning staff refused to clean the room or change the towels. The worst feature is the night club. As the clientèle all smoke... as well as drinking...they seemed to spend most of their time screeching outside the hotel. If you do make the mistake of booking the hotel, and believe me it will be a mistake, ask, nay demand a room at the back. Unless you don't want to sleep. The hotel instructions say it is a hundred metres from the metro- try at least 800 metres.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hppytourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. It is about a 10 minute walk from the nearest Metro station and the same from the mainline train station. The area isn't the most fashionable area of Rome, but I felt perfectly safe there both day and night. There are some pleasant and reasonably priced restaurants and cafes nearby. The breakfast is continental and the coffee and juices are from machines, but both taste fine. I would go and stay there again quite happily.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waytar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in worse hotels but it is a 2 star hotel and you get what you pay for. Stayed 3 nights and the only major complaints I have are that it is situated next to a night club that rocks till 4 AM and it has not Internet access. It is a little out of the way but within hiking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Thiefs - don't pay in advance for your stay!”
Reviews.Author: jreneelewis
Reviews.Content: I booked for two nights and when I arrived they demanded full payment for both nights up front. I left the hotel the same evening about three hour later and after giving them the key they refused to refund anything to me. The place is a dump and they are crooks .

Reviews.Title: “Basic but a good place tohang your head”
Reviews.Author: R&BRomneyMarsh
Reviews.Content: It was a bit of a culture shock to the system having not stayed in a 2* hotel (as rated thru' our travel agents) since our youth but we got what we paid for. The rooms were clean but basic and the same for washroom facilities. The ladies at reception all spoke english and were very nice. The breakfast was just rolls and cakes but some of the other residents brought their own food in! Yes there was a very noisy nightclub next door but we were so shattered at the end of each day's sightseeing that we just fell asleep thru' the noise anyway. The hotel is in a less salubrious part of Rome but within a 10 minute walk you are in the Testaccio district where there are lots of small taverna's etc most of which were heaving every night of the week. The hotel is to the south of Rome's centre but saying that it was only a 30 minute walk to the Colossuem etc. We walked roughly 10-14 miles each day but Rome is such an easy city to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms basic but you get what you pay for, I enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: Wolly7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Rome staying at the Hotel Pyramid. Took us 4 hours to eventually find the hotel with not much help from the young girls on reception when we called them for directions (I no that we should have done more planning but didn't think it would be that hard to find!!!)Anyway we eventually got there in 1 piece to a friendly welcome from young ladies on reception there english was much better in person.We got to our room to find it was pretty basic but is what we were expecting so weren't too disappointed. If you are looking for somewhere cheap and cheerful and a bit out of the way from Central Rome this Hotel is fine. We didn't really no what to expect with it being our first time Rome but just a little warning for you if you are not a heavy sleeper beware there walls are very thin and can get a little noisey which didn't bother us too much after a good 10 hours sight seeing, getting to sleep was not much of a problem. Breakfast was pretty basic bread rolls, croissants, coffee and juice but again it was ok we weren't expecting the full works!Our room was cleaned well with clean bed sheets each day and fresh towels (might be an idea to bring one of your own as they were quite thin) but we were happy with the service provided. In the evenings you will find a man on reception who I think was the owner but a very lovely man who was always happy to see you and gave us very helpful information. This hotel is not far from Metro stations so although it's not in the centre it's not a problem getting there and we enjoyed the little journeys there anyway. So all in all I probably wouldn't stay here again as there are so many hotels to try out but if you are going to stay here then if you go not expecting too much you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “mmm cakes”
Reviews.Author: dazzer_lost
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday about five months ago.After booking we came home and read trip advisor reviews.After reading some of them we thought about changing hotels.We re glad we didn t. We flew with Ryan air and on the flight they sell tickets for a transfer to the termi station in the centre of Rome.For a return transfer it cost 14 euros each,and we done this. When you arrive at Termi station buy a one euro ticket from one of the newspaper stands.The metro has two lines A and B. You need line B.Its about three stations away and is called pyramide.Turn left out of the station and go round the corner. The road for the hotel is about ten minutes down the main road on the right hand side next to Burger king. When we arrived at the hotel we were happy with it.The staff are helpful and the room was a good size,clean and comfortable. Its true the bathroom is a wetroom but we didn t find this a problem.There is a fantastic cake shop near the hotel Turn left out of hotel and right at the end of the road.Its about three doors down and is called Andreotti.The freshly squeezed orange juice and lattes are lovely and so are the mini cakes. For the drinks i mentioned and about four of the mini cakes it was only about five euros.Don t stay here and not go there. The hotel give you a street map and it shows you all the attractions.They reccomend the buses but we found you could get everywhere by metro. At the station buy a four euro ticket and you can use this all day on buses and metro.The colosseum is about three stops away from pyramide.We reccomend a guided tour.Its 20 euros each and they also guide you round the ruins opposite.Its also good as you miss the ques. St peters is a must see and you can get to that from metro line A which you pick up from termi.I can t remember what stop but it tells you what sights are at what stop on the metro boards.We walked to the top of the dome at st peters.Its 300 spiral steps but the view is worth it. Theres so much more we could say.Rome is great and as long as you wear comfortable shoes you ll love exploring it. The ABC Pyramide was a good hotel and if we were to go back to Rome we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but Definately would not go back”
Reviews.Author: tipsytraveler007
Reviews.Content: The Hotel overall wasnt too bad. I accept that us Australians are probably used to better quality hotels for 3 stars but that aside Ill start with the good points. The room was a decent size, plenty of room for three young girls and their luggage. The hotel staff were extremely nice, very friendly and helpful. Fantastic restaurant right around the corner (turn right out the door and right at the next street and three or so doors down) - we ate there almost every night! Bad points- major one was the BATHROOM. It was gross. Dirty, not cleaned while we were there, tiny, mouldy shower curtain. When you sat on the toilet your feet were literally on top of the shower drain. So when you showered EVERYTHING got wet. We were used to changing in the bathroom, being three single girls but we had to all get changed in the same room. The area was also extremely dodgy and we didnt really feel comfortable wondering around at night. There was some very suss men hanging around the club a couple of doors down called "sinister sounds.." enough said. Also very far out from the sights. When i go back to Rome i will definately spend more to stay in the center where its nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: juliee202
Reviews.Content: Have just returned today from a long-weekend stay at this hotel. As far as 3 star hotels go, this wasn't a great one. While the rooms were clean and well decorated, the air conditioning was poor (the requests to reception to turn it up fell on deaf ears) and 2 days running our used towels were taken and not replaced...requiring more visits to reception. We also had to leave a 20 euro deposit in order to have the tv remote controls, which was returned at the end of the stay. Beware of the strange bathroom setup, a shower inbetween the toilet and basin, in a tiny little room, with no defined space of its own...everything gets wet! As mentioned in other reviews, the breakfast is poor - consisting of either a bread roll or croissant and instant machine-made tea and coffee (why on earth would you go to Italy for Cappucino and end up drinking from an instant coffee machine...uurgh!). Eat elsewhere would be our advice... Also, a word of warning about the location...it is a run down area and next door to the hotel is a 'Live Music Venue'. Each night music was played until 2am - loudly. So loudly in fact, that we believed it to be coming from the next room until further investigation revealed the source. On a more positive note, the staff were all very friendly especially the gentleman who worked the night shift, and all spoke very good english. The hotel was reasonably well placed for transport links and there is a good restuarant around the corner (turn right outside the hotel and right again), the decor is basic but the food is very good and cheap..... Overall, we would describe our stay here as 'ok' but would only use it again as a last resort. We have stayed in better 3 star hotels that are more centrally located, but it was clean and safe and I guess you could probably do worse.

Reviews.Title: “The Pyramid was friendly and clean.”
Reviews.Author: GoCanucks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic: clean, close to the metro, and the people are friendly and helpful in English. Easy walking distance to many toursit places: Shelley's grave, St Pauls, and the catacombs. No internet connections in the hotel, but a friendly internet store is 2 doors away. I had a Great time! I found the bathroom/shower functional and had no problems at all with it. The breakfasts are skimpy. I'd advise eating at a local bar. I enjoyed it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcoRojo
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel with a good balance price/confort. Rooms medium sized and with air conditioned, satellite TV, phone and frigo. Small shower room with and they have no separation between shower and WC (so you "rain" all WC!!). Very basic breakfest, only tea or coffe and bread, honey, marmelade and butter and a juice. Closed to Pyramid metro station (2 stops from Colosseo) and Ostia Train Station (direct to Fiumicino). The metro is about 10 minutes walk. The area is not a beautifful one, with old buildings and not very clean but tho Hotel is OK. You have a Burger King just on the corner and some pizzas and restaurants closed to. The staff is very very friendly and help everything you need. Is a budget hotel and I will be ther another time!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In!!”
Reviews.Author: laineymason
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at this hotel and have never been more uncomfortable in a hotel ever. Location - near Pyramide Metro stop (5-10min walk) - have a look on a map of Rome and you will see how far out of the centre this is. As other people have mentioned the area is not the most desirable at night, did manage to find a couple of nice restaurants within walking distance, but as Metro's don't run too late, if you are heading into City Centre then expect to get a taxi back if you are having a late one. Hotel - entrance is up a side street, very basic reception which I don't have a problem with. I did, however, have a problem with the room. Very basic with only an ensuite shower/toilet room. Found it a bit shabby and run down - I think it actually looks worse than the pictures on this site. After one day in the room both myself and partner developed a red rash on our arms and legs which I assume was from the bed sheets or possibly shower. Never experienced anything like this in any other hotel and made for a very uncomfortable stay. I personally would not stay in this hotel again if they paid me. Yes it was cheap (about £40.00 per night) but I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “verry nice”
Reviews.Author: scufa
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome ,Pyrmid Hotel ,it is verry nice ,verry clean and it looks better then the photos . The rooms are very nice ,are very clean ,the staff is very nice and if I come back to Rome I will defenatly still go there . It is very close to Piramid metro and train station that will take U everywhere . It is close to colloseum 30 min. walk . Tips :visit Vatican is incredibele and on sunday around 11 U can see the Pope .Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for the sights”
Reviews.Author: London_fountain_man
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic but very good value for money. It is in easy walking distance to all the major sights (apart from the Vatican) and we did not feel the need to use the Metro (particularly after all the previous reviews). Just want to point out our experience of some other peoples concerns. Maybe we got lucky but didn't encounter any beggars, no bag thieves or pickpockets, no noisy club downstairs keeping us awake and generally Rome was not intimidating in the slightest, very easy to walk around and nothing but a welcome reception wherever we went. Getting back to the hotel we would say the food was adequate, the staff always pleasant and polite and the shower room OK. I don't know whether we would call them complaints as such but yes the towels were a waste of time and the walls were paper thin. The only noise we heard though was early morning with people walking down the corridors and stairs to breakfast so if you're not an early riser I suggest you get as high a floor as possible.

Reviews.Title: “OK but be aware!”
Reviews.Author: JohnandSueWales
Reviews.Content: As you have probably guessed from the other reviews, this is a basic hotel and, as the saying goes, you get what you pay for. One thing you should be aware of, which the others don't seem to have mentioned, is that there is a club next to/ under the hotel which is VERY LOUD till about 3 in the morning. As we were virtually above it and didn't get much sleep on Saturday night. The club was also open on the other nights (Thurs to Friday) but o be honest we were so exhausted from all the walking around Rome that it didn't disturb us much on those occasions. The clb may have only recently opened, hence the lack of comments, but in our view it was a serious drawback: hence the lower rating. On the other hand, it was clean, the wet room was fine (despite being off putting at first glance) and the staff was - for the most part- very helpful. And as someone says you don't spend much time in the room. We add our recomendation about the nearby restaurant (right then right again): we had the best, and best value steak ever. Don't be too put off by the area: the street the hotel is in is very unattractive but the surrounds are typical city suburbs. In fact, it's worth looking around a bit rather than heading straight into the city centre. You can take a pretty short walk to the river and follow it into the centre, seeing some things most guides don't mention like the Pyramid itself, a British war cemetary adjacent the old city wall and some outlying monuments. If you do head straight in, the Metro is close by and very cheap - but also very ugly. The local graffiti artists use the carriages as their canvas and they are extremely basic inside. Also be warned when using it at rush periods: at 6 pm at the Spanish Steps station I was robbed trying to et on by two men working together, who wedged me between them and stole my wallet. Luckily I kept most of my cash and my cards in a body belt- I strongly recommend you do the same guys. It did take the edge off the visitfor a while, but hen it could happen in any city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shanlica
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ABC Pyramid for 3 nights with my husband and son (aged 10). Found the hotel to be located in an unattractive suburb, but the area did not seem to be intimidating or threatening. It is close to the Pyramide metro station (about 5min walk) and several bus routes, so we were able to get around the city very easily. The hotel is not suitable for anybody who finds steps/stairs a problem as there are no lifts, but for any fit people (especially on a budget) the rooms are clean and adequate. The wet room which I know many people have commented on was not a problem for us - the shower was lovely and powerful and it was easy to control the heat. Yes, you should take a towel or two for yourselves (I think we all know that now!) but their thin cloths do work ok especially for children! As I had read previous reviews, we tried the restaurant around the corner from the hotel (right out of hotel, then right again - about a 1 minute walk) called the L'Insalata Ricci, which we found to be a lovely establishment with very friendly waiters and a great food selection. The menus were printed in both Italian and English, so you can make your choice in English and attempt to order in Italian if you're brave enough. I do think the waiters responded very well to our (very limited) Italian conversations, just one or two words or phrases are enough. We had very enjoyable, reasonably priced food here, I definately recommend this one. There are also several local shops in the vicinity of the hotel including some very good cake/pastry shops and others which sell reasonably priced water and other drinks and snacks. The ABC Pyramid also has a couple of vending machines in the lobby which sells water is 1 Euro a bottle. It also vends chocolate and I think crisps too. The breakfast there is OK if you like croissants (I don't but my husband said they were nice). The staff were very nice throughout our stay and will explain to you on arrival where to catch the bus to various monuments and locations around Rome. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and thought it represented excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Gillypep
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the Pyramid Hotel. For the price, we were really pleased with it. As we were out of the hotel most of the day, we just wanted somewhere quiet and comfortable to sleep and it didn't disappoint. The rooms, although small, were cleaned every day. Breakfast was adequate with fruit juice, rolls, pastries, etc. The hotel was only about a 5 minute walk to the metro which we used alot to get about as it's only a euro. About half an hour to walk to the Colliseum. Walking is really the best way to get about but take comfy shoes as there is alot of walking to do!!! We used to eat at the restaurant round the corner from the hotel - quite cheap and also frequented by the locals so it must be ok. We had an enjoyable four days. Rome is extremely busy and you take your life in your hands every time you cross the road!! Also plenty of beggars and street vendors which did get to be a bit of a nuisance but if you ignore them they will eventually leave you alone. Plenty of places to eat and drink and not all of them expensive unless in one of the squares. If we were going back, we would definately stay at the Pyramid Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to start from”
Reviews.Author: chezabelle
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a long weekend staying at the abc. We had a great holiday. The hotel was very basic... but it was also very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful - and did all they could when needed. they lent us a plug adapter when we asked where we could get one from... top service. We stayed for 3 nights and got a good nights sleep all the way through. The area you are in might look a little "rough" but to be honest we felt completely safe and relaxed walking around. The breakfast... yes it was machine coffee.... but very good machine coffee... and the pastries... YUM!!! You are going to be in Rome one of the most fanastic cities in the world... and i would hope that you wouldn't be spending all day sat in your room moaning that the telly is small or the towels are too thin. bring your own towels and shame on you for watching telly when on holiday. it is a great base to start from and march is a great time of year to go the weather was fab but the tourists are not there en mass yet. The main sights ie the forum / colluseum are a 30 minute walk but some great sights on the way.. and if your not feeling that brave the reception can book you a guided tour.. we went on the second day.. they use a great company and the guide we had was very funny and his insider info took us to the sights further from hotel. you could have done it yourself but it did take the hassle out of it and saves time if on a short break. we found the info on here really helpful when travelling to Rome (especially the info on a wonderful little restaurant called the L'INSALATA RICCA you turn right out of the hotel to the end of the street and right again and follow your nose. the food was excellent and prices VERY good.) if we were to go back we would not hesitate to use the abc again... 1/ take your own towels the ones provided really are of no use. 2/ eat a big breakfast.. you'll need it as you are walking and on the go all day. (really good map provided at reception.) 3/ make sure you check out the restaurant well woth a visit.. (we ate there every night!).

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cymru99
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 4 day trip to Rome and stayed in this hotel. I cannot fault it, the staff were pleasant and helpful, the rooms were clean and more than adequate. We were minutes away from the Metro line which will take you almost anywhere and the bus stop outside the hotel will take almost to the Vatican dootstep (no.23 bus). All around the hotel are very nice bars and restaurants. We can highly recommend Insalata Ricci which had beautiful food and didn't cost very much at all. just up the road is The Wine Club, brilliant selection of wine and very friendly staff. Around the corner is Zero Zero cocktail bar. If you buy a drink you can help yourself the the selection of tapas on the bar, free of charge. The only thing we would say about this hotel is the towels, definately take your own. All in all we cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for cheap weekend”
Reviews.Author: craigfssnow
Reviews.Content: I paid for Three nights B&B, flights and transfers to this gorgeous city for under £200 for my wife and I. This was not a main holiday, it was a romantic, inexpensive trip where we went for the sights and surroundings of Rome, not to stay in the hotel for any period of time. Thanks to Tripadvisor, I chose this hotel on the basis it was clean and cheap. The hotel is three stops from the main drop off in Termini on the Metro costing a Euro each. The tube system in Rome is incredibly less complicated than the multi coloured entangled lines of our capital's tube system as there are only two lines, A or B. From the tube the hotel is approximately 5-10 minute walk from the metro down a busy main street. To dispel some of the myths about the hotel being in an unsavoury area, this is not true. Irrespective of what time of night it is there will be the odd drunk wandering in and out of the traffic, but the drunks will not hassle you as they are too busy trying to clean the cars that stop at the traffic lights. There are no visible signs of drug dealers, muggers or hoodies in this area, just people who can't afford to live slap bang in the middle of the city going about their everyday business The hotel is small but the staff, like all the workers in Rome speak English, are friendly and at the recpetion give free sight seeing maps that are the best we found in Rome. A story I cannot dispel is the towels. They are no use to man nor beast but if you are reading this review then you will do as I did and take your own. The shower is fine. It is a wet room but those reviewers who asked where do you hang your towel and clothes - over a chair just outside the bathroom door. Breakfast is pastries and rolls with jams. Coffee does come out of a machine but if you are heading out, there are one or two small establishements that serve the odd cup of coffee (Insert irony here) Rome is beautiful - Yes it has grafitti, beggars and umbrella salesman everywhere you go but expressing your anger at them once is enough to send them on. If you are thinking when to go, January is a perfect time, warm enough and no crowds. From Pyramid, if you have your walking shoes on then you can get to all of the major sights (Colloseum is only a 10-15 min walk away) The tube is so easy though that even for those less mobile, you will get all the famous sights done. Hotel Pyramid - It's not fancy, it's practical for getting your head down and resting those acheing feet.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect much sleep”
Reviews.Author: johnbelfast
Reviews.Content: This hotel brings a new meaning to minimalist. Beds are so small you are afraid to turn over in case you fall out. Towels are.... well.. more suitable to call them sheets or tablecloths. Showering is an experience too. Where do you put your towels and clothes when the shower is the bathroom? Saying that, the hotel rooms are clean and cheap. Just dont leave the hotel after dark as it is in a very dodgy looking area with a lot of unsavoury people about. Very intimidating and genuinely worrying. Also very noisy. You wont get much sleep. Vending machine Breakfast. One more thing, dont rely on a wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Great value formoney”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was great. Nice rooms, medium size ( have stayed in smaller in Italy) Cleanliness was excellent ( cleaned every day ) nice clean floors, beds and bathroom which I am fussy about, bathroom is a wetroom but not too small would be better if it had a shower curtain . Nice breakfast, only pastries ( delicious ! ) and coffee, juice etc as in most Italian hotels, it is what we expected ( and for £30 per night was excellent ) the towels did not bother us, if they dry the Italians they dry us ! Italians only have the best, its just a matter of preference. We had a smoking room as one of our party is a smoker ( no smoking anywhere inside in Italy ) The other couple in our group had a huge balcony on the front, not much to see ( residential area ) except washing on balconies but gave a flavour of Roman life which I love to see. We had a leaky toilet cystern it flooded from the top ( was fresh water ) every time it was flushed but it was repaired on the day it was reported. Staff very helpful, young and friendly except for the old chap, but he was only on once during our stay. ( he rang us a taxi that ripped us off, it was not an official white cab) I would suggest taking a travel kettle as the coffee machine in the foyer was not working, the young girl on reception gave us a spare cup too!. No lift at the hotel which some times became a drag after a long day but only three flights so not to bad ( it would be hard on the elderly or disabled ) the location was ok but a little bit of a bind as the roads were a nightmare to get to the Piramide metro but once there it was no troulble using the metro ( not as daunting as I expected...just regular Romans going about their business......not full of beggars and pickpockets ) I've have never seen traffic like it ! but a lot do give way for you to cross, just watch for the scooters that don't and whizz around the cars that have stopped ! We ate all our evening meals at Insalata Ricci round the corner ( right out of hotel then right again, 3 minutes walk ) Was excellent and always packed every night whereas other places around were empty. Plenty of Italians eating there which is a good sign, also served excellent steak ( if you like it well done make sure you tell them, Italians cook it quite rare, they think we British ruin a good steak by over cooking ) Also pizza to die for ! ultra thin base that melt in the mouth !! All of us enjoyed our choices. 4 euros for pzza 10.50 e's for steak , they charge for bread and service charge ( 4 e's ) but their focaccia bread is delicious we did not mind paying. Overall excellent value and a very pleasant stay, would certainly stay again as we were just getting used to the travelling and findng our way round. Cannot think of any faults with hotel, only if it could be picked up and moved a little nearer to Rome centre.. but then it would be more expensive...........

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel for the money, great location to access bus or metro”
Reviews.Author: justthink03
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and helpful, the room was spot-less, and great access to buses or metro to take you everywhere you would like to go. The colosseo is 10 min by bus #3 and the Vaticano by bus #23 is about 20 min away. I must admitted i was hasten when i first look at it from the outside but found after the first night me and my mate decided we could not have picked a better place for the money and easy access to rome. Its was very safe with many places to eat right down the street. If i ever go to rome again, this is the place i would stay again, with out a doubt!!!!!! We loved it!!!!!! Thank you Pyramid hotel for making our stay a great one!!!...from american/english couple!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Higg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and found it to be an excellent small hotel. The room (and hotel in general) was spotlessly clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room also had very efficient ice-cold air-conditioning, a must for Rome in the summer! One small point is that the towels aren't up to much (clean but so thin as to be more like sheets than towels!) so we'd advise taking one of your own. Most people will take the tube into the 'centre' for their evening and just use the hotel as a base out but we found there are a couple of superb local restaurants and bars close to the restaurant if you want to experience the 'real' Rome with the locals. Out of hotel and turn right, end of the road and turn left. About 50yds up on your left is a great late-night bar, candle-lit with stunning contemporary decor and lovely staff. A little further along is a brilliant, very small local restaurant with (quite literally) pavement tables. The food was superb and staff couldn't have been nicer. At the end of the row was another, brand new modern bar and restaurant which, although expensive, was very 'cool' indeed and very popular with the young, glamorous locals. Overall, if we were returning to Rome we would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again. Don't be mistaken, it's not the Ritz but for the money it's as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jambo27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last month, basically its great for the price - no luxury. Staff informative and helpful, they'll give you tips on getting around Rome. The rooms are clean but take your own towels!! The bathroom is very small but functional, the walls of the hotel are very thin and you hear everything from adjoining rooms!! Beware, there's no lift and after a long day sightseeing the stairs are tough especially if you're unfortunate enough to be on the top floor!! The continental breakfast available is adequate but choice is limited. On arrival we were slightly concerned as the surrounding area is rundown but dont be intimated, we never felt unsafe walking around late into the evening. Once you get to know your way around it's fine. Metro great for getting around, the 3 day travel card for 11 euro is value for money and takes you to the main sights. The nearest stop to the hotel is Pyramide - around 10 mins walk. It's around 3 stops to the coloseum and 5 stops to termini which is the interchange. Beware of pick pockets on the metro. Once you get to a central point of Rome the majority of the main sights can be accessed by foot. There are some great little restaurants in the surrounding area and are good value for money. We loved Pizzeria La Badia - turn right out of hotel onto Via Del Gazometro then left. Would stay here again, basic but adequate for short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: scyw
Reviews.Content: For a basic and budget hotel, this is a very good choice. The room's small and it's about 4 metro stops from Colloseum, but for the price, it's above average. The bathing area and the toilet are connected but it doesn't harm me. Reception is friendly and helpful. Breakfast included, which is always nice. The only down side is that you'll have to carry your luggage up the stairs, which may get tiring. But you can't expect much more for that price...I paid ~60 euros for 2 per night.

Reviews.Title: “a great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (6 of us) ladies stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Very clean, extremely helpful and friendly staff; they couldn't have been more helfpul to us. the hotel was very conveniently located regarding metro and busses. The continental breakfast was more than adequate. All in all well worth it and very good value for money. The most striking comment would be the very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great local restaurant L'insalata Ricca”
Reviews.Author: chrischamb
Reviews.Content: Spent an enjoyable weekend at the Pyramid and found reception staff helpful, room clean towels maybe thin but changed on a daily basis and adequate for drying. Only disadvantage is the water system is noisy. Found an absolutely great restaurant 2 minutes from hotel, turn right then right again and you will find L'insalata Ricca. We ate here all three nights and were giving a warm reception and the meals were fantastic and a good price for the large meals we were given. Recommend the ham and buffalo mozzerela to start, and you cant go wrong with the squid for main course. We used the Terravision bus for transport to and from airport which saved a lot of hassle and good value at £9. Then get on to metro line B and 2 stops to Pyramid Metro station best to buy 3 day ticket. Regarding cigarrettes best to buy in city not at duty free in airport more expensive and you need cash.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not to great... but friendly reception.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One basic guide line which we were trying to follow was to book hotels near the main sites of the city. But this hotel was anything but near the primary Roman attractions. Offcource the metrostation was walking distance away. The rooms are really tiny and the bathroom are even samller. Also the walls are really thin. I recall walking to the 2nd floor and hearing people fight in the rooms below very clearly. The only saving grace was the freindly reception. The man was the reception was very friendly and helpful indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought it would be....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I've been to. Me and my husband had 4 luggages to carry to the 2nd floor but in actuality it was like the 3rd floor because there was a long flight of stairs just to get to the 1st floor. There is no bell service no one to help you with baggage there's no lift or elevator so if you have a lot of luggage you'll just have to suffer. The walls are so thin that you can hear whatever goes on next door and outside. The doors are so light that whenever someone opens and closes their doors, it just slams shut. At night and in the morning all you hear is door slamming. I guess you get what you pay for. The hotel was cheap and the location is convenient. To get around town, all you have to do is go to the bus stop across the Pyramide bus station. It's about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There's buses that'll take you all around town. The people at the front desk are friendly and helpful and they do speak English. Don't ask the front desk to get you a taxi to the airport becauase it's a rip off. We paid 75 EURO. The taxi guy looked like he was a private taxi not one of those with a meter. Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, some great restaurants nearby!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cacky_0
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of the ABC Pyramid and I was a bit concerned before we arrived. It wasn't as bad as I had thought. The rooms are quite small and dark and yes, have very thin walls - it wasn't me snoring honest!! The staff are friendly and the breakfast is very basic but ok. The shower room is interesting, very compact. On the plus side, the neighbourhood is good with a few nice bars, a truly outstanding restaurant called Zero Zero (turn right onto via del Ostiense and walk to end of road it's just at the corner, really lovely).The area is very handy for the metro, it's a good base for exploring - but it isn't going to win any awards for luxury!! We enjoyed our stay, it's basic but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in November for a few days and its true the staff are friendly, speak good english and the hotel is clean. However the walls are the thinnest I have ever come across in my life. They are that thin you can hear every word of other guests conversations and even the snoring of somebody who was in the next room. The towels are just lengths of table cloth and the bed was horrible, very squeeky,creaky and uncomfortable. The breakfast was basic but the coffee lovely. Overall its very basic but clean so if you do not mind the noise and can sleep through other peoples snoring, give it a go!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the abc pyramid 1st nov 2005... Excellent hotel clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms great value for the cost, shower room a must. Situated in a run down area, to our english ways though once you know where you going then this isnt a problem.. Metro no problems just keep yourself to yourself, 3day travel card for 11euro's, Best stop for hotel is the pyramide.. Back to the hotel, as previous people have commented the towels leave a little to be desired lol! Great break had by the both of us and will definately be returning to the ABC Pyramid.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: spiro62
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room are basic but clean and tidy (no lift), very good value for the price. Rooms are made up every day and fresh towels provided. Continental breakfast adequate and there is a restaurant around the corner that provides excellent food at a very reasonable rate. Staff are friendly and very helpful. The surrounding area is not very awe inspiring but don't let that put you off. Direct train from the airport to Ostiense station (30 minutes and 5 euros) and you can either walk (10 minutes) to the hotel or spend 8 euros on a taxi. The Metro station is 5 minutes away (4 euros for all day ticket) that links to the majority of the sites you would want to visit (the best way to see Rome is get to a central point and walk).

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but a good base”
Reviews.Author: Ian_D
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Pyramid in mid September. We found the rooms clean, but basic. As another reviewer said, the towels are a bit...well, useless. They're like table cloths. The staff however, are really nice, and their English is good. You have to ask for the a/c to be turned on. We needed it. But by 2am, the room's a bit cold. It can only be controlled at the reception. They've just had what look's like Italy's version of Freeview installed. Which is good news...if you want to watch Al Jazeera, or Persian TV. Anyway, you don't go to Rome to watch TV. The hotel is about 5 mins walk away from the Piramide Metro station, which is only about 4 stops away from the main train station, and the Metro interchange. Next to the Piramide Metro station is a little cafe. After a hard days shopping or sightseeing, stop off, and have a couple of Nastro's, from teh nice lady with the red flat cap. Oh, and at night, there's teh cocktail bar, around the corner from the hotel. Most cocktails €6. In a nutshell, a good, clean base. But that's all it is. There again, you don'y go to the Eternal city to spend enternity in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Another place, never to stay...terrible (and sketchy) location...no elevator, unclean...and not central - avoid it if at all possible

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome in February 2005. After reading reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor we tried to change the hotel but it was too expensive. The hotel is situated in a side street about 10 minutes walk from the Metro. We had a clean basic room with a wet room, which does not suit everyone, but OK for a short stay. The room was cold after being out all day but it was February! The staff were friendly and breakfast was basic but OK. We found a great little local restaurant literally around the corner, good food and wine and very reasonably priced. If planning a stay at the Pyramid get the train from the airport and the metro. Very cheap and easy to do and you wont get ripped off by taxi drivers. When using the metro BEWARE! Pickpockets work in teams on the crowded carriages and my wife had her bag unzipped on at least 3 occasions. We would recommend the Pyramid for a basic value for money hotel and remember, when you visit Rome you want to see the sites not the inside of a hotel room. So we say go for it!

Reviews.Title: “felt safe at the htl, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and considered changing hotel, but glad we didn't. Felt safe enough walking home at night, tube is 5 mins walk and felt safe there, had to be more careful in rome centre with pick pockets than near the hotel! The colesseum is about 35 mins walk. Room was basic but clean, hardly in it as too much to see & do. Cocktail bar round the corner is ideal after long day walking the cobbled streets of Rome. Thoroughly enjoyed our weekend there. If going to the colesseum pay extra for a tour as you find out so much more. Visit Villa Borgehese (park) top of spanish steps to take in the view, well worth it. Enjoy!!

HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Magazzini Generali 4, 00154 Rome, Italy
